title: Development Associate
description:
##### ***Reports to: Associate Director, Development***
**Supervises: None**

  

Founded over 40 years ago, Womankind works tirelessly to create a future where we Rise Above Violence and our communities can innovate towards collective well-being, restoration, and social justice. Formerly known as the New York Asian Women’s Center, Womankind uses the multidimensionality of its Asian heritage to work alongside survivors of gender-based violence as they build a path to healing.


Womankind offers comprehensive services in 18+ Asian languages and dialects, including our 24/7 multilingual helpline, safe and confidential emergency residences (shelters), counseling, family and immigration legal services, economic empowerment workshops, wellness activities, creative arts therapy, youth programs, and so much more.


Womankind seeks a **full-time Development Associate** to join our Development & Communications Team, currently composed of a Chief Development Officer (CDO), an Associate Director of Development, an Institutional Grants Manager, a Communications Manager, and a to-be-hired Events Consultant. The Development team raises funds to support the entirety of Womankind’s programs, operations, and infrastructure; increases visibility for Womankind as a leader in the gender-based violence field; and develops external partnerships that support resource building for the organization’s long-term sustainability.


**This position is non-exempt full-time: 40 hours per week hybrid divided between in-person (two days per week) and remote work with additional days in-person as needed for meetings and events.**

  

**Primary Responsibilities:**


The Development Associate will be primarily responsible for managing development operations and supporting the Development Department across a variety of fundraising and communications functions. They will work closely with the Associate Director, Development, the Chief Development Officer, and Development & Communications team to implement Womankind’s fundraising plans and activities.


**Development Operations**


* Overall management and administration of Womankind's fundraising database (CRM), includes fulfilling a lead role in our upcoming database migration and implementing current and new processes and systems for accurate tracking of fundraising efforts from multiple sources
* Maintain up-to-date and accurate donor data and donor prospect data
* Manage gift processing from start-to-finish, including coding donations and importing donation data into the database
* Ensure timely processing of gift acknowledgement letters
* Perform data pulls from the database, analyze, and organize the data to produce accurate donation and donor fundraising reports throughout the year
* Create and manage email, mailing, and donor constituent lists for fundraising campaigns and events as well as for broader external communications
* Act as the primary Development team member in ongoing communications with the Finance team handling donation coding and fielding and responding to requests for donation supporting documents, and any questions on donations and pledges
* Participate in streamlining inter-department donation tracking systems with the Finance team by actively participating in monthly donation reconciliation and supporting the annual audit
* Manage specific external vendors, consultants, and partnerships related to the fundraising database, campaigns, and events, including submitting Requests for Expenses, and working with Finance to ensure timely payments


**Individual Fundraising & Institutional Giving Support:**


* Perform prospect research for individual, corporate, and foundation funder
* Support funder records management for diverse streams of funding both private and public, including various forms of corporate giving (e.g. matching gifts, corporate sponsorships and grants), foundations, and government grants and contracts
* Manage in-kind donation processes as related to tracking the donations received and responding to requests for donor acknowledgement and highlighting partnerships on Womankind’s social media and/or website
* Support the design and implementation of new development opportunities by working with the Development and Senior Leadership team to develop donor cultivation and stewardship plans
**Social Media and Communications Support:**


* Support the Communications Manager with social media engagement as needed, including drafting content, posting, and tracking social media reach
* Support the Development & Communications Team with writing awareness raising content, such as blog posts and e-newsletter articles
  
**Opportunities for Growth:**


**Champions for Womankind Monthly Donor Program:**


* Provide support and grow into managing the ongoing implementation and growth of Womankind’s Champions, a dedicated group of monthly donors, overseeing a growing portfolio of donors who give on a monthly basis and cumulatively up to $999.99 annually
* This includes monthly donor tracking, monthly donor communication, updating credit card payment information, and creation and implementation of strategies for engagement, retention, and upgrades
  
**Qualifications:**


* Bachelor’s Degree or comparable experience and at minimum 2 years of professional experience
* Experience implementing and adapting development operations processes in a fast-paced team environment
* Demonstrated experience managing and working in a database or CRM
* Strong project management skills and proven ability to meet deadlines
* Commitment to data integrity, attention to detail, accountability, and sensitivity to preserving confidentiality of donors and funding information
* Strong writing and communication skills
* Ability and willingness to work with a highly collaborative team
* Proficiency in Microsoft and Google Suite and ability to learn how to use and navigate third-party fundraising platforms, such as Benevity, GiveSmart, etc.
* Knowledge and/or enthusiasm to learn and engage in issues of gender-based violence, gender justice, Asian and Asian American communities
* Available for evening events on occasion

  


**Compensation Package:**


Womankind offers a competitive and outstanding compensation package. Annual salary range for this position is between $50,000 and $55,000, based on the candidate’s experience, skill set, education, and other criteria. Top benefits include health/dental/vision insurance, generous paid time off, 403(b) retirement plan, and much more.

  

**How to Apply:**


Email resume and cover letter to: careers@iamwk.org. Please include your name and “Development Associate” in the subject line. No calls, please.

title: Advocate, Project Free (Bengali)
description:
##### ***Reports to: Manager, Project Free***


Womankind uses the multidimensionality of our Asian heritage to work alongside survivors of gender-based violence as they build a path to healing. We are working tirelessly to create a future where we Rise Above Violence and our communities can innovate towards collective well-being, restoration, and social justice. In addition to promoting healing and safety through service provision, Womankind promotes gender justice through research, coalition building, policy analysis, and community education and mobilization.


Project Free is the anti-human trafficking (HT) Program within Womankind. The advocate will provide specialized community outreach and awareness raising, emotionally supportive counseling and case management to survivors of human trafficking. Recognizing that survivors can experience various forms of exploitation and often hold multiple truths, the advocate will have the opportunity to provide support to all survivors of gender-based violence. The advocate will work closely with the Project Free Manager and will receive weekly supervision, training and have access to the resources available at Womankind. The role will also work with various teams at Womankind to bolster learning and deepen the mission of the organization.

  




**Essential Functions:**


Direct Client Work (50%)


* Provide case management, emotionally supportive counseling, and crisis intervention to approximately 20-25 clients. This includes supporting clients with family reunification and drafting letters of support.
* Practice trauma-informed care, ensuring clients receive prompt and professional services and holistic support
* Maintain proper documentation of case work and organization of physical and electronic case files
* Provide legal, immigration, benefit and housing information and referrals
* Contribute ideas and resources to improve Project Free and the broader organization
* Support helpline calls, as necessary


Outreach (20%)


* Conduct and participate in training, outreach and community education events, at least 1-2 events per quarter
* Support in reporting and logistical planning
* Support in partnerships development


Administrative (20%)


* Attend team site meetings and actively contribute to the collaboration of work projects happening within the program
* Attend all staff meeting to learn about organizational wide updates
* Attend and facilitate (when assigned) monthly Client Services meetings to support in-service learning of all Client Services staff


Professional Development (10%)


* Attend trainings and/or conferences (internal and external) to build capacity and knowledge on human trafficking and other forms of gender-based violence


Organizational Responsibilities


+ Work in partnership with program team to build collaborative work environment
  


  

**Qualifications:**


+ Minimum: Bachelors in Social Work, Psychology or related field, plus at least 3 years direct practice with vulnerable populations
+ Oral and written fluency preferred in Bengali
+ Experience with anti-violence work, the Asian community, criminal justice, client advocacy and/or human trafficking
+ Open-minded, proactive and mindful
+ Ability to exhibit personal responsibility and commitment to work; follow-through and accountability
+ Proficient in Microsoft Office, Zoom, Salesforce and other database systems
+ Must have a high level of organizational skills
  


  

**Work Location and Work Schedule:**


+ While the advocate will be stationed in Manhattan, New York, reasonable travel is expected to another community office depending on client needs as required.
+ The work schedule for the position includes regular day shifts (9 am-5 pm). The role must be willing to work outside the normal business hours, due to the needs of the program. Womankind has developed a hybrid working model. The required onboarding period for the newly hired advocate will be in-person 5 days per week for at least three months. Thereafter, the hybrid model will be in place, and the advocate will be able to work remotely for up to 2 days per week.
  


  

**Compensation Package:**


+ The annual salary range for this position is between $48,000 to $50,000.
+ Womankind offers a competitive and outstanding compensation package. Top benefits include health/dental/vision/FSA/HRA plans, generous paid time off, holidays, 403(B) retirement plan, commuter transit program, and much more. Please note that the vaccination mandate applies to all Womankind employees.

* Proactively and consistently communicating with the office team
* Collaborating closely with the market's co-manager
* Collecting and reporting market data and success metrics
* Setting up and breaking down the market manager tent and display, market signage, and any other Down to Earth equipment as needed
* Posting to Facebook/Instagram on behalf of the market on market days and work with the Digital Marketing Manager to provide information and images from the market for marketing purposes
* Selling farmers market branded items
* Taking initiative in providing customer service; serving as a market host to welcome and engage shoppers, promoting good relations between vendors, our company, and the shoppers

* Reporting successes, concerns and opportunities to Down to Earth Markets; sharing feedback and ideas
* Occasionally representing the farmers market at community events and through flyer distributions

* Complete remote training, using a computer or smartphone, outside of market hours
* Complete the required flyer distribution blitz outside of market hours
